title: Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge benchmark reveals record performance | Trusted Reviews
description:
![samsung galaxy
s5](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**After much rumour and speculation, what looks to be the[Samsung Galaxy S6
Edge](https://www.trustedreviews.com/samsung-galaxy-s6-edge-review) has
finally passed through the AnTuTu benchmark test.**

The results are fairly impressive too, with the device setting a record score
for the benchmark suite at 60978, as reported by
[PhoneArena](http://www.phonearena.com/news/The-Galaxy-S6-passes-through-
AnTuTu-breaks-all-records-and-reveals-specs_id65798).

That puts the phone’s multi-stage test score higher than any other handset
previously recorded.

This also means we can break down just why the device’s chipset came out on
top, with clear improvements being made in 3D objects visualisation.

What’s more, we can also glean that the device is using the [octa-core Exynos
7420](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/samsung-galaxy-s6-exynos-chip-
benchmarked).

That’s Samsung’s custom-built chip set to combat this year’s other primary
flagship chipset, Qualcomm’s [Snapdragon
810](https://www.trustedreviews.com/opinions/snapdragon-810-features).

The advantage that the Exynos chip has is that it’s built using a 14nm FinFet
manufacturing process, compared to the less efficient 20nm one used by
Qualcomm.

**Related:** [MWC 2015: What to expect from the Barcelona
expo](https://www.trustedreviews.com/hubs/mwc-2015)

Other clues to the device’s final form include a listing for a 5.1-inch
display, a screen resolution of 1440 x 2560 (576 ppi), 3GB of RAM, and 32GB of
built-in storage.

A 20-megapixel rear camera and a 5-megapixel front-facing shooter also
appeared on the results sheet.

While none of this is particularly surprising, it’s interesting to see an
apparent confirmation of Samsung eschewing the Snapdragon series, as well as
hopeful results for the Exynos chip’s performance.
